The Town of Coventry cautions recreational users of Tiogue Lake to be aware. Water samples taken at Briar Point Beach on 7/07/2020 came back with elevated levels of Enterococci (https://www.epa.gov/national-aquatic-resource-surveys/indicators-enterococci), bacteria that are typically not considered harmful to humans. The threshold in Rhode Island is 60 colony-forming units per 100 milliliters of water. The recent samples came back with 106 colony-forming units per 100 milliliters of water. Resampling will take place and results will be posted on https://www.coventryri.org/index.php/briar-point-water-testing-results.
Any questions can be directed to Coventry Parks and Recreation (401) 822-9107. Briar Point Beach/Park remains closed for the summer of 2020.

FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE

The Town of Coventry, Rhode Island is a separate governmental entity from the Central Coventry Fire District.

The Town of Coventry, Rhode Island is not the controlling body of the Central Coventry Fire District, which is one of four fire districts located within the borders of the town. Each district is a separate governmental entity with the sole purpose of providing Fire protection, emergency medical services and street lighting for the residents of the fire district. Each fire district is an independent taxing authority, separate from the Town of Coventry, and is controlled by an independently elected board of directors, with the head of the board or “President of the Board” elected by the board members.

Any comments made by any board member, either individually or as a group, are the opinion of that particular member or board and do not reflect the opinion of the Town of Coventry, RI.

Graham Waters
Town Manager
Town of Coventry, RI
1670 Flat River Road
gwaters@coventryri.org
